titles.title: Equal Pay Improvement Report Act of 2005
Equal Pay Improvement Report Act of 2005

To direct the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to prepare a report about how the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 has been used by public and private sector employers to foster or exacerbate pay inequity, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Employer-Employee Relations.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Equal Pay Improvement Report Act of 2005 - Directs the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to report to Congress on how the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 has been used by public and private sector employers to foster or exacerbate pay inequity.
